title: Ronaldo’s genius reason for ridiculous haircut
text:
The ultimate sore loser play 0:48 Paper Talk: Reason for Ronaldo’s ridiculous haircut, Mata incident fuelled Clattenburg’s PL exit February 20, 2017 1:07pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS RONALDO reveals the reason for his ridiculous haircut, how an incident with Juan Mata fuelled Mark Clattenburg’s departure from the Premier League, and the stressful life of Cristiano Ronaldo’s body double. 
It’s all in Monday Paper Talk! 
RONALDO’S GROIN BEHIND WAS RIDICULOUS HAIRCUT 
Ronaldo’s haircut during the 2002 World Cup remains one of the worst in football history. 
Now the Brazilian striker has revealed why he shaved off all his hair apart from the little section at the front of his head prior to the start of the tournament. 
“My groin was hurting. I was only at 60 per cent. So I shaved my head,” he told ESPN Brazil. 
“Everybody was only talking about my injury. When I arrived in training with this haircut everybody stopped talking about the injury.” 
It obviously worked. Ronaldo scored a brace as Brazil beat Germany in the final to claim their fifth world cup. He was also the tournament’s top scorer with eight goals. Ronaldo with the World Cup in 2002. Source: News Corp Australia 
HOW MATA INCIDENT FUELLED CLATTENBURG’S PL DEPARTURE 
The Premier League’s highest profile referee Mark Clattenburg has left England to become the Head of Referees in Saudi Arabia. 
No doubt he will be making a hefty salary in the Middle East, but according to former top-flight Referee Chief Kieth Hackett, the move has been coming for sometime - and the reason involves Juan Mata. 
In 2012, Clattenburg was accused of calling Mata, who is known as one of football’s nicest players, a “Spanish t***” during Chelsea’s 3-3 draw with Manchester United. Hackett believes the lack of support Clattenburg received after the incident made him feel isolated. 
“It’s bad news for English refereeing,” Hackett told The Star. 
“The Premier League has lost the world’s best ref – it’s a massive blow. 
“I think it’s down to poor management. There were incidents when the PGMOL haven’t supported or clarified decisions when they’ve needed to. 
“Mark felt after the Mata incident no-one supported him. He was left high and dry.” Juan Mata (L) and Mark Clattenburg (C). Source: AFP 
RONALDO’S BODY DOUBLE REVEALS CRAZY STRESS 
Cristiano Ronaldo is one of the most recognisable people on the plant, so it’s no surprise his body double, Diego Davilla, worries about trying to replicate his look to the finest detail. 
“I have to take care of my body a lot,” he told UOL Esporte. 
“He is a world-class athlete and has incredible physical qualities. I have to have my body as similar as possible to his all the time, although there are obvious differences due to the genetics. 
“I have a haircut with his personal hairstyle, Miguel, and I always have to have my hair exactly the same as his. A post shared by Diego Dávila (@didavila23) on May 28, 2016 at 4:01pm PDT 
Davilla also revealed that he and the Real Madrid star have grown closer together while working. 
“My relationship with Cristiano is very good,” he said. 
“It’s true that at the beginning of the work we were more distant, perhaps because of shyness, but over time we got to know each other and I can say that Cristiano is a lovely person. 
“It’s a huge pleasure to work with him. He likes to be with me and I with him. He’s an incredible person.” 
It remains to be seen whether Davilla will play any part in the TV drama (about Syrian refugees) Ronaldo has reportedly signed up for to star along Angelina Jolie. A post shared by Diego Dávila (@didavila23) on Feb 5, 2017 at 6:35am PST 
The footballer was named by the Turkish program’s director as one of the high-profile cast members he had secured to start filming Hayat Koprusu in April. 
Ronaldo has made no secret of his ambition to break into acting. “Why not? It is not my objective at the moment, but I have had some invitations,” Ronaldo said in 2016. CR7 nutmeg embarrasses Lopez 
DEMBELE SWITCHES ALLEGIANCE... AGAIN 
Oh the life of a 13-year-old football sensation. 
After Celtic starlet Karamoko Dembele switched allegiance from Scotland to train with and represent England’s Under-15s side, he has made another backflip on his international future. 
Dembele has chosen to once again represent Scotland, the nation he’s made two appearances for at Under-16s level, and has been called up as one of the 20 players to represent the country in a UEFA development tournament this month. Karamoko Dembele (C). Source: Getty Images 
SUNDERLAND’S SECRET PLAN TO MOVE TO LONDON 
David Moyes’ Sunderland are battling for their top-flight status near the bottom of the Premier League. 
But according to The Sun, the Black Cats are making plans to set up a training camp in London - 200 miles away from their base - in order to make the team “more attractive to foreign investment or even London-based players and make it easier to sign top talent”. — David Coverdale (@dpcoverdale) February 19, 2017 
WHAT BALOTELLI DID TO GET SENT OFF 
At the time it was unclear what Mario Balotelli did to receive his third red card of the season when he was sent off in Nice’s 1-0 win over Lorient. 
However, referee Tony Chapron revealed to L’Equipe why the Italian striker was sent off. 
“He insulted me in English,” said Chapron. 
“I won’t say more but it was something classical.” 
But Nice goalkeeper Yoan Cardinale was less convinced as said Balotelli “did not say much”. 
“Is he victim of his reputation? Do you think it was a red card because it was Balotelli? It’s ridiculous,” Favre said, as quoted by L’Equipe. 
“If there is enough for a red card, they send off, if there is not enough, they do not send off.” Balotelli's strange send off
